newsitem.title: UK: MOTOR RACING-BARRICHELLO UNHURT AFTER 280 KPH CRASH.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-BARRICHELLO UNHURT AFTER 280 KPH CRASH.

text.p: Brazilian Formula One driver Rubens Barrichello escaped unhurt from a 280 kph crash during testing at Silverstone on Thursday.
After walking away following a rear suspension failure, the Stewart driver said the controversial new tyre regulations proposed for next year were partly to blame for the severity of his impact.
Barrichello was testing the new grooved tyres which are to come into use next year.

He said: "I don't like the new tyres, especially after the experience I have had. Something broke on the rear suspension which put me into a spin but if I had been on this year's tyres I would have just spun into the gravel.
"The grooved tyres didn't slow me down as much and I thought that, when I was spinning in the car, it would stop. But it didn't. It went across the gravel and then there was a big boom.
"It would be better and safer to have bigger tyres and reduce the power."
Mika Hakkinen's McLaren was fastest in testing for the British Grand Prix in a time one minute 22.97 seconds.
Michael Schumacher's Ferrari was second with 1:22.99 and Jordan's Giancarlo Fisichella third (1:23.00).
